pullRequest.body:
Introduce a counterpart of `Functor.toMonoidalFunctorOfHasFiniteProducts` for categories with chosen finite products.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #17695 
- [x] depends on: #17701 

The given definition remains computable since every needed data are in the `PreservesLimits` and `IsLimits` instances around. Some of the `conv` blocks followed by simp/rewrite can be golfed with `erw`, but that is something to avoid if I understand correctly, so I went down the longer but `erw`-free route.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [55729afa4d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17613/commits/55729afa4d49f3db632104021ab6d610fc15715d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Functor.toMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts`
`+ Functor.toOplaxMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts`
`+ instance (A B : C) : IsIso (F.toOplaxMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts.Î´ A B)`
`+ instance : IsIso F.toOplaxMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts.Î·`
`+ instance [F.IsEquivalence] : F.toMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts.IsEquivalence := by`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Note that in the future, `PreservesLimit` may become a `Prop` (if someone does the refactor that maintainers would agree with), so that we should lose computability at some point.
In order to develop more API at the same time you get `Functor.toMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts`, I would suggest developing an API `chosenProdComparison` similar to the `prodComparison` in `Limits.Preserves.Shapes.BinaryProducts`. Under the assumption that `F` commutes with suitable colimits, we would get a `chosenProdComparisonIso`. Developing this API (and similarly for the chosen terminal object) should facilitate the proofs in the main definition here.
Right, it should be more elegant that way. Next revision will probably depend on #17691.

The part exclusive to this PR starts at line 424.

In this refactor of the PR, I first define an oplax monoidal functor independently of any product-preservation hypothesis and use #17691 to promote it to a strong monoidal one. I couldnâ€™t get the typeclass inference to find `IsIso F.toOplaxMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts.Î·` (same for the tensorator) despite the instances defined in #17701.

- [x] depends on: #17695 
- [x] depends on: #17701

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17695~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17701~~

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11484517782/job/31962474188)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11484517782/job/31962473821)

In a few situations, it is desirable to have instance parameters at the beginning rather than at the end:
```suggestion
  {D : Type uâ‚} [Category.{vâ‚} D] [ChosenFiniteProducts D] (F : C â¥¤ D)
```

Doing the following is about as fast:
```suggestion
    all_goals simp [â† Functor.map_comp]      
```

```suggestion
        ChosenFiniteProducts.prodComparison_snd, â† F.map_comp, F.map_id]
```

```suggestion
        ChosenFiniteProducts.prodComparison_fst, â† F.map_comp, F.map_id]
```

```suggestion
instance : IsIso F.toOplaxMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts.Î· :=
  terminalComparison_isIso_of_preservesLimits F

instance (A B : C) : IsIso (F.toOplaxMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts.Î´ A B) :=
  isIso_prodComparison_of_preservesLimit_pair F A B

/-- If `F` preserves finite products, the oplax monoidal functor
`F.toOplaxMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts` can be promoted to a strong monoidal functor. -/
@[simps!]
noncomputable def Functor.toMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts : MonoidalFunctor C D :=
  MonoidalFunctor.fromOplaxMonoidalFunctor
    (toOplaxMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts F)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/ChosenFiniteProducts): Monoidal functors between categories with chosen products
